When one minus eighty one equals negative seventy six , therefore replacing those results back into original equation yields : .... simplifying further leaves…... $$\boxed{15x - 76}$$ ... Let's simplify the expression term by term. As hinted before, combining like terms yields $15x$, since $19x - 4x = 15x$. Also simplifying further gets you $-80$ because when substituting into our simplified equation it does hold true; i.e., using x=0 would yield zero as expected while keeping constant value (-80) within any variable coefficient such as 'a'. Hence giving your required solution $15x-80$; making sure each operation was properly applied according to algebraic rules regarding addition/subtraction along side distributive property being used correctly herein without alteration hence no need rewriting steps back again . The answer is: $15x-80.$
We start solving this problem as follows:$$\begin{aligned} &\phantom{=}(19x + 1 - 4x - 81)\\ \\ &=19x - 4x + 1 - 81\\ \\ &=15x - 80.\end{aligned}$$So, simplifying this yields $$\boxed{15x - 80}.$$.

First let's collect like terms together so as to simplify it easily. \[19x + 1 - 4x - 81= (19x-4x)+(1-81)\]So the simplified form would look something like $$\boxed{-3x-80}$$And since no further simplification could occur here, our task ends right now! $$19x + 1 - 4x - 81.$$Combine like terms ($19x$ and $-4x$, along with constants $1$ and $-81$) separately:$(19x - 4x) + (1 - 81)$$15x - 80.$This simplified form cannot provide different output depending on what value replaces 'x', unless additional contextual information changes interpretation—like considering special cases beyond standard algebra rules ((e.g., dealing with limits approaching infinity or undefined scenarios)). direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. To simplify the given expression, we need to combine like terms. There are no other variable terms besides $19x$, so it remains as is when combining with constant terms related to $x$. For the constants, adding $1$ and $-81$ together equals $-80$. Hence, putting both results back into one term, we get $$\left(\begin{array}{c} 19 \\ x \end{array}\right)+\left(\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -\text{constant} \end{array}\right)-\left(\begin{array}{r} 4x \\ 81 \\ 19 & x \end{array}\right)$$ yielding $$19x + 1 - 4x - 81$$ Simplifying further combines the coefficient of $x$, giving us $15x$. Now simply add/subtract the constants leaving you with "$-$" times "-80". Your full expanded equation now reads $$15x - 80$$ Thus your overall solution ends up being $$\boxed{15x - 80}$$ I hope that helps! Feel free to ask for any additional information
